variants.Description in input context: p.G2019S (LRRK2 mutation associated with Parkinson's disease)
p.L176Q (PARK2 mutation linked to Parkinson's disease)

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells expressing LRRK2 variants were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased LRRK2 kinase activity observed in p.G2019S variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 served as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparison between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: LRRK2 kinase activity within 1.5× standard deviation of wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: LRRK2 kinase activity exceeding 2× standard deviation of wild-type.

Material used.Description: Transgenic mice with SNCA p.G104E mutation were analyzed.

Readout description.Result Description: Excessive alpha-synuclein aggregates detected in substantia nigra.

Biological replicates.Description: Single cohort of transgenic mice analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: Sections from three different brain regions analyzed per mouse.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mouse brain used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic mice used as negative control.

Material used.Description: iPSCs from PARK2 p.L176Q mutation carriers were differentiated into dopaminergic neurons.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced PARK2 protein levels and increased oxidative stress markers.

Biological replicates.Description: Three iPSC lines from independent patients analyzed.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type iPSC-derived neurons used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected cells used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mann-Whitney U test for non-parametric data.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: PARK2 protein expression within 1× standard deviation of wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: PARK2 protein expression below 0.5× wild-type levels.
